intro: Cracca multifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cracca, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is aromatic and has been used historically in herbal medicine. Cracca multifolia is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
